info.name: Cards API OAuth2
info.description:
## **Introduction**

Welcome to the NBG Cards sandbox API.

 This API version uses the OAuth 2.0 protocol for authentication and authorization. Please use the following scopes : **sandbox-obp-cards-api-v1**

 The Cards API allows you to access the list of user cards and card information. This sandbox API provides a standard RESTful interface to developers to facilitate their development of customer related applications. It is a flexible toolbox of data and services to test your ideas on a simulated dataset. 

Here you'll find details about our API and the complete list of the available endpoints. The Cards API is based on the Open Bank Project v3.0. This sandbox API provides a standard RESTful interface that enables applications to: 
1.	Retrieve data about: 
 -  The list of cards for a logged in user 
 - The list of cards for a logged in user at a specific bank 

**Getting Started with the Sandbox** 

Sandboxes provide a simple way of testing APIs without any real impact, meaning that no personal or financial data is used. 

**Step One: Create your sandbox ** 

Create a new Sandbox application by invoking the POST /sandbox. This call will generate a new Sandbox with a unique sandbox_id. 

**Important!** Before proceeding save the sandbox id you just created. 

When you create a sandbox, users and sandbox specific data are generated as sample data. 

Each sandbox created through NBG Cards sandbox API is compatible with other NBG Open Bank sandbox APIs. 

The following HTTP **header parameters** are required for every call: 
1.	sandbox_id 
2.	 request_id
3.	 authorization 

**Sandbox Operations:** 
1.	Create a sandbox: POST /sandbox 
2.	Export a sandbox: GET /sandbox/{sandbox_id}
3.	Import a sandbox: PUT /sandbox/{sandbox_id}
4.	Delete a sandbox: DELETE /sandbox/{sandbox_id}


[Sandbox Postman Collection](https://github.com/i-bank/PostmanCollections/)  

Created by **NBG** 

See more at https://www.nbg.gr/

item.name: Get cards for the current user

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

request.description: Returns data about all the physical cards a user has been issued. These could be debit cards, credit cards, etc.

response.name: Get cards for the current user

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.
